description:
Cladophialophora yegresii CBS 114405 is a species of fungus belonging to the genus Cladophialophora. It is a dematiaceous (dark-pigmented) hyphomycete, which means it produces dark-colored, septate (divided) hyphae and conidiophores (specialized reproductive structures that bear conidia, or asexual spores).

The strain CBS 114405 was originally isolated from a soil sample collected in Yegres, Venezuela. This species is known to produce a characteristic dark-colored mycelium and conidiophores that bear clusters of ellipsoidal to oblong conidia.

Cladophialophora yegresii is classified within the order Chaetothyriales, a group of fungi that are commonly found in the environment and can occasionally cause opportunistic infections in humans, particularly in immunocompromised individuals. The genus Cladophialophora includes several species that are known to be involved in various types of phaeohyphomycosis, a fungal infection characterized by the presence of dark-pigmented hyphae in the host tissue.

Further research may be needed to fully understand the ecology, physiology, and potential clinical relevance of this specific strain of Cladophialophora yegresii.
